answers.answer: We need to do a medical workup to arrive at a diagnosis, including history taking, laboratory, x-ray, and so on.In the meantime, try to do gentle stretching of the tight muscles of the lower back and thighs to maintain muscular flexibility.

question: I've had back pain for the last two years, it start with spasms that eventually contracted the muscles, removing the courve from my spine. For the last two weeks i have been having severe stomach cramps and chest pains. I am an 18 year old male with diabetes, I also have trouble sleeping, only getting 2-4 hours a night if at all. Could the stomach and chest pains be related to my bad back?
title: In need of some advice.
